info.title: Planned Order
info.description: The service contains planned order header, planned order capacity and planned order components. The information is sent in the request as a payload. You can read, create, change and delete components of orders and also use this service to schedule planned order operations.

x-sap-shortText: Manage planned orders using this synchronous inbound OData V2 service

values.text: [Make-to-Stock Production – Discrete Manufacturing (BJ5)](https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolP/BJ5 " Link To BP ")
[Make-to-Stock – Process Manufacturing Based on Process Order (BJ8)](https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolP/BJ8 " Link To BP ")
[Make-to-Stock Production – Repetitive Manufacturing (BJH)](https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolP/BJH " Link To BP ")

x-sap-extensible.description:
If you are working with key user extensibility, the API can be extended by custom fields on the following business contexts (field usage for this API needs to be selected):
* Manufacturing: Planned Order Header (PP_PLANNED_ORDER_HEADER)

[How to add an extension field to an API](https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0f69f8fb28ac4bf48d2b57b9637e81fa/ce819b8557194ae0aa180ba4ac6a04de.html)

get.summary: Reads information on the header data of planned orders.
get.description: Reads information available on the header data of existing planned orders. You can use the standard OData system query options to refine your request.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expand related entities, see [Expand](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=63)

post.description: Creates the header data for a new planned order using the properties you provide.

parameters.name: PlannedOrder
parameters.description: Planned Order

get.summary: Reads information on the header data of a single planned order.
get.description: Reads the information for a planned order that you specify using the planned order number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expand related entities, see [Expand](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=63)

patch.summary: Updates header data of a planned order.
patch.description: Updates some of the header data of a planned order. You can update some date and time information, quantities as well as indicators.

delete.description: Deletes a specific planned order that you specify using the planned order number.

parameters.name: PlannedOrder
parameters.description: Planned Order

get.summary: Reads the header data of a planned order including the capacity data.
get.description: Reads  the header data of a single planned order that you specify using the planned order number. The response includes information on the capacity data belonging to the order.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Order items by property values, see [Sorting](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=65)

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

parameters.name: PlannedOrder
parameters.description: Planned Order

get.summary: Reads the header data of a planned order including the components.
get.description: Reads  the header data of a single planned order that you specify using the planned order number. The response includes information on the components belonging to the order.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates new components for a planned order.
post.description: Creates new component data for a single planned order that you specify using the planned order number.

get.summary: Reads the capacity data of planned orders.
get.description: Reads the capacity data of planned orders. You can use the standard OData system query options to refine your request.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

parameters.name: CapacityRequirement
parameters.description: ID of the Capacity Requirements Record

parameters.name: CapacityRequirementItem
parameters.description: Capacity Requirement Item

parameters.name: CapacityRqmtItemCapacity
parameters.description: Individual Capacity of a Capacity Requirement Item

get.summary: Reads the capacity data for a single item.
get.description: Reads the capacity information for a single capacity item that you specify using the capacity requirement ID, the capacity requirement item, and the item capacity.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

get.summary: Reads the data of planned order components.
get.description: Reads the data of planned order components. You can use the standard OData system query options to refine your request.

parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

post.summary: Creates a new component for a planned order.
post.description: Creates the component data for a planned order using the properties you provide.

parameters.name: Reservation
parameters.description: Number of reservation/dependent requirements

parameters.name: ReservationItem
parameters.description: Reservation Item

get.summary: Reads the data of a single planned order component.
get.description: Reads the data for a single planned order component that you specify using the reservation number and the reservation item number.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Select properties to be returned, see [Select](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=68)

patch.summary: Updates the data of a single planned order component.
patch.description: Updates the data for a single planned order component that you specify using the reservation number and the reservation item number.

delete.summary: Deletes the data of a single planned order component.
delete.description: Deletes the data for a single planned order component that you specify using the reservation number and the reservation item number.

post.summary: Performs detailed scheduling of a planned order
post.description: Based on a task list a detailed scheduling of a planned order will be performed.

parameters.name: PlannedOrder
parameters.description:
Planned Order  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

post.description: Schedules planned order operations to be dispatched or deallocated using the scheduling mode and scheduling strategy.You can either choose the dates or retain the operation dates to dispatch the orders.

parameters.name: PlannedOrder
parameters.description:
Planned Order  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: CapacityRequirement
parameters.description:
Capacity Requirement  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: CapacityRequirementItem
parameters.description:
Counter  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: CapacityRqmtItemCapacity
parameters.description:
Counter  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: OpSchedldStartDate
parameters.description:
Latest Start Date  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes and prefixed with `datetime`, e.g. `datetime'2017-12-31T00:00'`)

parameters.name: OpSchedldStartTime
parameters.description:
Latest Start Time  
(Value needs to be in duration format, enclosed in single quotes, and prefixed with `time`, e.g. `time'PT23H59M59.999S'`)

parameters.name: OpSchedldEndDate
parameters.description:
Latest End Date  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes and prefixed with `datetime`, e.g. `datetime'2017-12-31T00:00'`)

parameters.name: OpSchedldEndTime
parameters.description:
Latest End Time  
(Value needs to be in duration format, enclosed in single quotes, and prefixed with `time`, e.g. `time'PT23H59M59.999S'`)

parameters.name: OpSchedulingMode
parameters.description:
Scheduling type  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: OpSchedulingStatus
parameters.description:
Status  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

parameters.name: OpSchedulingStrategy
parameters.description:
Component of the Version Number  
(Value needs to be enclosed in single quotes)

post.description:
Group multiple requests into a single request payload, see [Batch Requests](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=152).

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*

multipart/mixed;boundary=request-separat.example:
--request-separator
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET A_PlannedOrder HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json


--request-separator--

multipart/mixed.example:
--response-separator
Content-Type: application/http

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: application/json

{...}
--response-separator--
